author: blukas
title: Best scanner right now, careful with important documents
content:
This scanner works great... as long as you do not use it for anything important with many pages. The app does a great job with OCR and the image quality with automatic line straightening truly makes this better than any other scanner (I've tried many). 

However; I just used this app to scan a few hundred pages in separate documents and folders and I regret it all. The app crashes after scanning for a while, which is fine except I only noticed much later that the app would combine random documents from different folders, remove names, and straight up delete existing documents when it crashes! I have already recycled the pages that got messed up so this is a permanent problem now. I have deleted and reinstalled the app multiple times with the same result. 

The app is great - so long as you export anything important immediately so it doesn't get mangled by the app later.

author: Platypusversusturtle
title: Not perfect but definitely the best
content:
It's easily the best mobile scanner available and I hope the developers keep it functioning for me forever and ever. Its quick to scan and edit and although it has its quirks it is amazing for a scanner that just uses your phone camera. Every document that comes into my life goes into this scanner and latee saved on my computer so I can keep all my paperwork organized digitally. 

The only necessary improvement for this app would be in the manner it helps you store and organize your documents. It is currently a frustrating system and i wish I could keep all docs organized in the app and not have to transfer to my desktop. It needs a better filing and referencing interface. Still gave it 5 stars to keep the app alive but if it doesnt improve I will drop a star because 4 is more accurate, so app developers please work hard on that interface for the next update! 

BTW this is my 1st EVER app store review because I am too busy to write them. That should show everyone how dedicated I am to this product. I need it in my life and would love for to work out its quirks. Thanks devs and thanks customers for reading my review; I hope it helps.

author: blukas
title: Best scanning quality, worst scanning app
content:
This scanner works great... as long as you do not use it for anything important with many pages. The app does a great job with OCR and the image quality with automatic line straightening truly makes this better than any other scanner (I've tried many). 

However; I just used this app to scan a few thousand pages in separate documents and folders and I regret it all. The app crashes after scanning for a while, which is fine except I only noticed much later that the app would combine random documents from different folders, remove names, and straight up delete existing documents when it crashes! I have already recycled the pages that got messed up so this is a permanent problem now. I have deleted and reinstalled the app multiple times with the same result. 

The app is great - so long as you export anything important immediately so it doesn't get mangled by the app later.

UPDATE - 1 Month later I'm getting even more issues just trying to get my data out of the app. Since I have 100's of files each with up to 200 pages in them I wanted to transfer them through iTunes file sharing. Turns out the app crashes before it even loads the list of all the files available in the app. Now I have to upload each document in batches of 3-4 so it doesn't take so long that I worry that it has frozen :/

author: MiguelitoBB
title: Almost perfect.
content:
This is a great app because it is so efficient and basically just "gets out of the way" which is one of the hallmarks of great software in my opinion. It's fast and the auto scan feature is great (basically the camera is on and the app is looking for a page in the image - when it finds one it automatically snaps an image of the camera is still and then crops the image down to the page. This makes it much faster. 

I deducted one star because of the cloud features. It only lets you have one google account - I have one for my family, a personal account and a work account and need to upload documents to all three at different times. It's a pain to have to log out of one, log into the other, go through authentication, etc just to upload a document to a different account.

Years later, my review below still stands. Except the app gets better and better! Yay!! Sooo convenient!!

author: FL Beach Blonde
title: Excellent Scanner But I Got This To Fax Which Lacks Essential Info
content: So, this is probably the best scanner app I've ever used and I've used Many.  However, I bought this while frantically searching for a better Fax option than iFax (took too long) and I was really frustrated.  First, I couldn't figure out how to import/fax docs that were already in my Google Drive account, DropBox, Adobe/Adobe Cloud, etc..  I ended up having to re-scan all my originals, which was time-consuming & angering bc I was always pressed for time.  Maybe there's no way to do this?  The only "import" function I found was with pics in iCloud/on my iPad.  I wanted a PDF.  Then, there was no transmission receipt. Aaarrgh!!  A dialogue box told me it was successful but that's not quite the same, plus it disappeared in seconds.  No receipt for the fax purchase either.  No way to track my fax.  Where did it go??  To a server?  Directly to the recipient?  Was it secure?  I have many questions.  Not very pleased about that.  Boo on the online mag (Gizmodo) that recommended this as the best FAX app available.  Grrr.

author: David in LA
title: Solid, Quality App
content: This app does the job well, whether you are working with a picture you take using the app, or with a picture taken from your camera roll (including screen shots). Surprising resolution of documents when using the app to take the picture; amazing, really.

author: dadofdavid
title: Highly recommended
content:
I recommend this app to everyone. Some people have asked, after watching me use it. It's nearly perfect. I do wish its photo color sense was better. That's the only part that has let me down. I also wish it had more editing options, but I can work around that.
 
Being able to adjust the skew ranks it head and shoulders above a camera. I found myself photographing a program before a performance, and wishing I'd chosen this app instead.
I've even managed to make some documents more readable with this app.

I store music on my iPad. This is so helpful for handouts. When I use the computer scanner, I still use this app for the final edit, if I want to remove unnecessary material with cut and paste, this app makes it easier and better looking. I've even used it to clean up another's sloppy cut and paste work. I can adjust the size and move it to a program that allows scrolling or notations. I can share it with fellow musicians as PDF or JPEG, according to their needs. It interfaces with all the other programs I use.

Overall, it's a workhorse that I use every day.

author: gtar dorq
title: Game-changer for this working musician
content:
I'm a professional guitarist who works in a variety of different bands and situations, and I'm constantly  learning new music for gigs. I've used an iPad for reading sheet music since shortly after it was released in 2010. 

Scanner Pro has created a great workflow for capturing printed music and getting it into my preferred sheet music PDF app,   ForScore. Scanner Pro's automatic scanning features work extremely well and it does a good job of de-skewing and converting the scanned pages to black-and-white. As I capture them, the pages are saved directly to dropbox, where I can easily import them into ForScore.

author: OshCFII
title: Super clean, super simple scanning
content: Scanner Pro is a great tool for quickly scanning and adjusting images. It is very easy to create a workflow with iCloud for use as an expense report receipt scanner, for example. Simple, solid, and useful. I can't ask for anything more.  3D-touch support for the iPhone 6s makes this an even easier tool to integrate into my workflow.

author: clearly751
title: Blown away
content: I have owned this app for years and generally switched between it and Scanbot to get the best scans. I just used it again for the first time in a few months today to scan a multi-page document and I am blown away. Under fairly poor lighting conditions (at nighttime under a yellow lamp) Scanner Pro gave me a perfect OCR scan of my document. Both pages were perfectly aligned, the edges of the pages were perfectly clean, the angle looked perfect, the crease in the paper was gone, and the pages looked perfectly white even though I took the scan under yellow tinted lighting. I tested the scan‚Äôs OCR by searching a few random words (in PDF Expert) and it worked perfectly. Wow - I don‚Äôt know what secret sauce Readdle has been infusing into this app lately but it‚Äôs miles ahead of where it used to be, even though it‚Äôs always been one of the top quality scanning apps in the App Store. Bravo, Readdle! Keep it up! PDF Expert and Documents have been invaluable apps to me; I hope Readdle keeps pushing forward.

author: AdamSonOfJohn

content:
I don't remember what I originally paid for this app, but whatever it was, it was beyond worth it.  It has single-handed my solved more nuisance problems than I can list at the moment.  The leading use for myself is tracking receipts -- there's literally no other technology that you would realistically have on you immediately after purchasing an item.

After NiteIze's Steelie mount products, Ballistic's Tungsten case, and particular screen protectors, Scanner Pro is hands down the most crucial must-have.

author: SBesh
title: Fake Reviews Buyer Beware
content: OCR program does not correctly digitize characters.  The amount of work required to correct the mistakes is most likely equal to the time it would take to manually type what you've scanned.  The reviews on here are completely overwhelmingly positive.  The fact is, no one nowadays would care to take the time to write a one paragraph positive review if the app is working as it should and as described...especially using their thumbs from a mobile device.  They write positive reviews to cover up the bad ones.  Apple has no control over who writes the reviews and if they are from verified customers.  Beware.

author: Cleanout
title: WOW! This App Is AWESOME!!!
content:
I use Scanner Pro for all my work over the road, scanning and storing all my business documents for instants my fuel receipts, Scanner Pro allows me to create a folder label it and then scan my fuel receipts in the folder quick and easy. Its great! 

Once you create a labeled folder anytime after that each document you scan into a that folder Scanner Pro will not only time stamp the time year and date, but it will allow you to add to it or relabel it to your liking. 

One of the best things I love about Scanner Pro is once you scan anything you can share the document from the app via email, text or any of the social media platforms available as well as print from your smart phone. 

I have to say of all the scanning apps I've used Scanner Pro is hands down the best app for my purposes and believe me what I mentioned is just the tip of the iceberg when it comes to this little app with big business function. 

The best part is, everything I've mentioned so far about this app has been about the free version which only scans in black and white. The $12. buck version scans in color.  I'm looking forward to checking out that paid version. Wait did I just say that?

I recommend this to anyone who wants a good portable scanner. Works a lot better than just taking a photo.

author: AvidReaderandListener
title: If you use digital docs, get this app
content:
I like to have a copy of every document I sign, even school permission forms for my children. Sometimes I am not near my scanner, but I am usually near my phone. One quick photo is easily reduced to a b/w scan, then opened in PDF Expert converted to a PDF that upload to Dropbox.

Scanner Pro automatically corrects the angle of a photo to give a clean, flat copy. It also allows the user to make fine-tuned adjustments if desired.  

The whole process takes a couple of minutes. Better. I can snap a photo now and convert it to a scanned PDF later if pressed for time. Best of all it works seemlessly. Great app!

author: Big A 4077
title: The Best Scan App.
content:
I bought this app and I use it at my store when customers tell me they need a travel printer and scanner. It's hard to find one small and cheap. I tell my customers they can use this app and it's cheaper than a $300 mobile printer, if not, better to waste $3 bucks versus $300. Twice my customers have been really happy. Even though my work doesn't require me to use PDFs, it's good to have. I purchased Turbo Scan cause I read it was better than Scanner Pro, yet I find myself switching back to Scanner Pro when I need copies of documents. I like the user interface better and the capture of the image. Scanner Pro does everything I need and everything you will want as well.

Update Sept 22 2017

I still love this app, it has gotten better over the years, no regrets, if you are reading this download it. I will help you either now or later in life.

author: TransitionQueen
title: My savior
content:
I love this app.  I use it almost everyday to capture -everything.  At meetings I'm constantly scanning flip charts, a slide of a presentation, or someone else's notes.  I scan handouts, homework assignments for my child, notes at meetings I need to remember, my child's handouts to send to his friends who forgot theirs.  The list goes on and on.  It scans in color, black and white, photos, text.   I save it or email it.  I can add it to my photos, the cloud,  or print.  It has saved me over and over! 

The single only drawback for me was when I got a new phone I forgot and lost all my documents.  I was crushed.  I'm sure there is a way to sync so that doesn't happen again-I just forgot to do it!  I highly recommend it!!

author: xRaphael1
title: Great app for digitizing paperwork
content:
I've been using this app ( the paid version) for maybe 3 years. It's not expensive although if you aren't in the habit of paying for any apps then $5 may seem like a lot. I think I paid $5 anyway. This app turns your phone into a reliable document "scanner" for less than a scanner wand, flat bed scanner or any other hardware solution for a portable scanner. It's very simple math and paying for the app keeps ads out your face and supports the great work this company is doing.

The quality does not correspond to the camera quality of your phone but, for documents that are clean and well lit with type or hand written text, you get good readable digital reproductions. You really can't beat the ability to save documents with the same device you carry around with you normally. It frees up clutter while giving you piece of mind that you can send official documents to people via email, on your phone or uploaded files to the cloud.

author: incineration
title: Portable scanner? Look no further!
content:
Almost all scanner apps provide same features such as de-skewing and gamma correction but after trying over 5 popular apps in this category, I found Readdle Scanner Pro the ultimate scanning app for my iPhone and iPad. It detects page corners in real-time, de-skews the scanned document quickly and changes the contrast and brightness automatically to give you ace-high quality without any further modifications.

It's as easy as tapping a single option in the Photos app or iMessage to convert a photo into a scanned document. OCR and distortion correction are some of its appreciated new features.

The interface is designed well, the final result is legible and the quality is higher than its competitors. Highly recommended...

author: J.D. Brown
title: Best Scanner App
content:
TO THE DEVELOPER: Readdle, I love your app, and have rated and reviewed it accordingly. I would greatly appreciate if the app would no longer interrupt my work to solicit my review (which again, I have already given). 

Scannable is super easy and fast, but isn't good at creating uniform documents (sizes were an issue for me). Scanbot is decent, but has workflow and detection issues. Scanner Pro gets is right most often, is most consistent with quality, and is generally the best app for organization. My only complaints are: 1. Rating nag screen doesn't go away even after rating (while rare enough, this is bad, and also persistent throughout Readdle apps) 2. The custom share sheet ‚Äî most of the time, I just want to message or Air Drop my document. The trade off for this custom sheet is the option for a custom workflow, and is really nice.

author: blukas
title: Best scanning quality, worst scanning app
content:
This scanner works great... as long as you do not use it for anything important with many pages. The app does a great job with OCR and the image quality with automatic line straightening truly makes this better than any other scanner (I've tried many). 

However; I just used this app to scan a few thousand pages in separate documents and folders and I regret it all. The app crashes after scanning for a while, which is fine except I only noticed much later that the app would combine random documents from different folders, remove names, and straight up delete existing documents when it crashes! I have already recycled the pages that got messed up so this is a permanent problem now. I have deleted and reinstalled the app multiple times with the same result. 

The app is great - so long as you export anything important immediately so it doesn't get mangled by the app later.

UPDATE - 1 Month later I'm getting even more issues just trying to get my data out of the app. I can either upload directly to a cloud service (takes about 1min/MB ish), attempt to download through iTunes (causes app on iPhone to crash before anything actaully loads in the file sharing list). 

I really, really regret using this app to scan so many important things.

author: Craig22071
title: Incredibly useful and easier than using a PC
content: Easily scans pages or photos into .pdf files or Word OCR docs (which you can e-mail, etc. right out of app). I last used for a work project, to scan old pictures into .jpeg's for a friend, and today to scan 37 pp of documents for a refi (took about 3-min for 37-pp). Has manual or auto scan (on auto just hold phone over page ... app finds edges and captures page in seconds). Full color perfectly clear images. Also has choices to select pages from large scans (such as separating my 37 pp scan into 3 e-mails due to e-mail file size restrictions). Faster and easier than my PC scanner or office multi machine, and it's always in my pocket.  The more I use it the more I love it.

I use this all the time. I collect all of my dad's health information, I collect gift cards, I get movie stubs, everything.

title: if you knew this existed you wouldn't use anything else.

i have, too many printers: Literally a canon MF8200Cw (Color Laser) - Canon 100Pro (InkJet Photo) & a Canon ip110 (portable battery operated)
blah blah blah. I despise having to create, document & keep the record; but for the love of money I would have deleted and destroyed every useless file in my archive.

this application allows you to do just that-
mentally. while keeping convenient copies in those lofty clouds we never have to see.
unless its necessary. It's peace of mind as well as appearance keep-up with an indecipherable filter that makes it look like, you are not as intelligent as you are (clearly if your still reading) and you wasted precious time out of your life to use an actual analog scanner of olden days. 

professionally precise, ultimately simple.

I wouldn't care to write a review, but the utility of such a smart solution left me obligated to comment.

buy it. delete everything else.

author: J.D. Brown
title: Best Scanner App, but nags too much
content:
I left a 5-star review and a thoughtfully written review after the first prompt from the app. That was over a year ago, and since then I continue to have my work interrupted by a full screen prompt to leave a review for the paid app Scanner Pro. I've emailed the developer multiple times about this. I'd pay a subscription fee just to never have to deal with this on Readdle's apps. Alas, this hostile design element remains in ALL of Readdle's apps, and I don't know what more I can do about it. I know it's dumb, but 1-star reviews from now on. You've got my money (for iOS and Mac), and I'll happily pay for future updates, but that's it as far as Readdle and me are concerned. 

TO THE DEVELOPER: Readdle, I love your app, and have rated and reviewed it accordingly. I would greatly appreciate if the app would no longer interrupt my work to solicit my review (which again, I have already given). 

Scannable is super easy and fast, but isn't good at creating uniform documents (sizes were an issue for me). Scanbot is decent, but has workflow and detection issues. Scanner Pro gets is right most often, is most consistent with quality, and is generally the best app for organization. My only complaints are: 1. Rating nag screen doesn't go away even after rating (while rare enough, this is bad, and also persistent throughout Readdle apps) 2. The custom share sheet ‚Äî most of the time, I just want to message or Air Drop my document. The trade off for this custom sheet is the option for a custom workflow, and is really nice.

author: IpadUser123456
title: Best Scanner App Available!
content:
Scanner Pro is a powerhouse. The quality, speed, and, most importantly, the functionality complement each other in such a way that has allowed me to unplug my sheet fed scanner. 

I've used many scanning apps including Evernote's Scannable Application, which is in beta stage in comparison to Scanner Pro.

I'm not bashing Scannable, or Evernote. I really like Evernote's concept of having everything accessible from a central database, but I feel as if they should focus more on their Parent Application. 

Scannable has a good concept but the bugs present are currently intolerable. I would use it just because I didn't know that Scanner Pro did what it can do (I've had Scanner Pro for about two years and it is finally getting the use it deserves).

Evernote, for me, is like many say, a second brain. Scanner Pro's auto upload feature allows me to effortlessly import directly into Evernote.

I then have a Google Drive account linked. Scanner Pro's favorite feature allows me to quickly organize important documents such as receipts into Google Drive where I can access effortlessly during tax time.

I frequently back everything to a external drive, to ensure myself I will always have a copy.

Having multiple copies reassures me that I won't lose data.

Clouds are still not perfect. I've lost data in almost every cloud related software. (Google Drive, OneDrive, iCloud, Evernote, and the list goes on.)

Highly recommend Scanner Pro!

content: Scanner Pro is the most versatile and accurate of the several scanning apps I've tried during the past few months. It beats the others for OCR accuracy, and it handles multi-column text (e.g. newspaper stories) very well. I like Scanbot's user interface better, but that app is utterly befuddled by multi-column material. I don't care for Adobe Scan's spare UI and limited user options. Scanner Pro's UI leaves something to be desired, but it can be managed OK with experience. Integration with other Readdle apps is a plus.

author: PixelRogue
title: Good app, but could be much better.
content:
01/01/2017
Asked yet again to rate - so annoying to be begged to rate.

Work flow still way too many taps.

Still no indicator of a successful upload.

Still no upload with auto delete functions.

12/01/2015 (3 stars)

Good app, but more for the casual user. For those that do heavier scanning, the app lacks.

PROS
- sharp scans 
- share options incl. WebDAV
- responsive support 

CONS
- too many taps for basic tasks
- inconsistent work flow & UI
- takes too much time

IMPROVE RATING:

‚Ä¢ Simple indication that a document was successfully uploaded. Instead, requires manual test to see if you get an overwrite request to know it was actually uploaded. Simple check mark would suffice .

‚Ä¢ Auto delete once successfully uploaded. Too much time goes into selecting documents to delete after they have been uploaded. Auto delete function exists in competitor apps and it works great. Huge time saver.

‚Ä¢ More consistent workflow. Too many taps, sometimes your button to proceed is in the top right, sometimes too left etc. UI needs to be streamlined and consistent. To many taps to do basic actions such as crop adjustment or even save.

-----
Appears there is not much in the way of user testing or sticking to a plan. "Wouldn't it be cool if ..." ideas seem to distract from the discipline and sacrifice that make apps great. No user testing, and you can't trust or count on the app holding to itself long term... üòí Dev & product leadership have their own way of maturing ScannerPro, which seems to miss the general targets.

-----
Matt - your review saved me from upgrading. Thank you for the details.
Btw - rating still shows as 5 stars.

title: Office tool in your pocket
content:
I've been using scanner pro for at least a couple of years, and watched it develop new capabilities in each new version. I use it for several different purposes, frequently in combination with GoodReader.  All of the stuff I used to carry in my wallet gets scanned, shifted to GoodReader, and put in an appropriate folder, frequently behind a strong password.  Some of these are things, like a medicare card (which has your SS No. on it) that shouldn't be in your wallet anyway.
    I've also used scanner pro to handle transfer of legal documents on the fly--contracts, etc.  Convert them to PDFs and send in the email.  I'm sure I've only scratched the surface of what the app can do, but it really works for me.

author: Chetstone
title: Amazing +!
content:
I thought Scannable was the cat's pajamas but this one is the cat's tuxedo!

I was using Scannable to scan a 50 page document with a very unusual page size and a mix of Roman and Asian characters on each page. It seemed to do well, but when I looked at the document on the computer about 10 pages were out of focus and had to be done over, and a few more were slightly fuzzy but acceptable. 

I decided to try this app based on my positive experience with the developer's PDF Expert. With the exception of one page which was so blurry I noticed it while capturing, so was able to immediately redo it, all 50 pages were razor-sharp. Bravo!

Another advantage of this app is that it can store/transfer anywhere. Scannable can only transfer PDFs to Evernote, so it requires another step to get the doc where you want it.

One thing Scannable did better was that it somehow recognized the correct orientation of these weird pages. With this app I had to rotate the pages when done -- an easy job on PDF Expert for Mac.

author: Home Business
title: Convenient Scanner on the Go
content: This is a great app that can be used so many times when you are not near a copier or fax machine.  This creates a multiple page document and can be saved as a PDF with your unique file name.  It can be sent in an email or in a text message.  I am often asked what the difference is between using this app or just taking a picture with your phone.  Your phone will only take one picture per page. This means that if you have a five page document, all five pages will be unique files that you have to send separately and hope that the recipient will keep together to re-create what was sent.  This app does it for you and can copy in color or black and white.

author: BradGess
title: Sharing is needlessly awkward
content:
For some reason Readdle decided to roll their own sharing menu instead of using the iOS sharing menu. This makes is really difficult to accomplish simple sharing tasks, like sending a document to somebody over iMessage. It would be better if the would get rid of their custom sharing UI and replace with iOSs sharing menus.

Another thing I ding Readdle for with the custom sharing menu is that "Email" doesn't work with their email client, Spark. It only works with iOS's built-in email app.

If Readdle didn't duplicate the iOS sharing menu they wouldn't have any of these problems and be a 5 star app, but it's useless if I can't easily share a document.

author: DavidBowieZoe
title: Don't do it!!!!
content: Pick another app!!! This app is great if you only need to scan a couple of pages. Whenever I scan 10-20 pages you cannot email them from the scanner because the file is too big. The only way is to save the scanned document in iBooks first and email the pages from there. But the HUGE problem is that whenever I scan a bunch of pages the app makes the rest of my phone go haywire for days. I can't access my email at all, it shuts other apps down as soon as I open them, and it shoots my data through the rough where I reach my Verizon data limit in a day or two even at the beginning of a billing cycle. I have to do a reset on my iPhone each time. This happened on both my iPhone 5 and now on my 6s.

It was not.  It's organisation and icons are confusing, at best.  One whole file I had thought I had scanned is nowhere to be found -- I'm going to have to return at considerable expense to myself.  The framing of the documents is off, so portions of documents are gone.  Will not be using again.

content:
It hasn't disappointed yet. This app does everything one would expect out of a scanner app.

I rarely scanned documents before getting this app about 6 months ago. It was a pain. Whether I used my desktop scanner or the photocopier down the hall it was guaranteed to take at least five minutes. Now I can have the same quality image I would expect from our photocopier using this app instead. It is quick, intuitive, and produces documents I feel comfortable using as a professional. On top of that it interacts flawlessly with my Gmail and Dropbox accounts, making it much more powerful than any other scanning option I have. This is very empowering software.

The OCR, which converts text to text that can be edited, is tricky. I have found that no single app excels at OCR in every situation. Results will vary, with each one doing a better job in some situations. But Scanner Pro in my experience gives the best result more often than the others, so is among the best.

title: A little confused/frustrated
content:
So maybe I am not doing it right, but for some reason when I try to take a picture of my documents, the square just hovers over the page without taking a picture, despite the fact that I've pressed the button to snap a picture of it. The square continually adjusts without ever taking a picture, yet immediately takes a picture when I move the camera closer or further away from the paper, thus blurring and blackening different parts of the paper. 
A family member recommended this app to me because it works really well for them. I will keep trying with different documents until I finally figure this app out- I know it works, so many people have written reviews on their positive experiences with this app.

The auto document recognition feature works better than any other and best of all is the OCR / text recognition tool, which enables you to take a photo and then to convert any reasonably legible text & handwriting into digital text, which you can then copy and paste into where ever you may need it. This app is great and has been a staple in my life and work for just about a year now!

title: This app is a huge time saver!!
content:
I work in a church and when I make the bulletins for Sundays, I make large print ones for people who may need them. I struggled for a long time to find decent copies of hymns or to take clear photos and scans of hymns that I could print larger. This app is amazing, it cuts my printing time in half at least and produces clear and crisp images every time that I can just email to myself and print. In short, it makes the task enjoyable again. 
The only thing I would change is the crop feature. I wish that it would allow me to straighten an entire edge at a time and not just corners. But it's a small price to pay for a fantastic app.

Update: I've asked Apple to remove this review so if it is still here, then disregard. They have not removed it yet.

I updated the app and I have iOS 10, yet it does not send faxes or email me my documents. 

What's even worse is that the app told me 'fax sent successfully' when it definitely wasn't, and I have over $300 of desperately needed income depending on that fax. There's even a pop-up confirming the $0.99 purchase when it doesn't actually happen.

I gave 2 stars instead of 1 because I at least was able to preserve the documents by saving them to photos. It is also good that the $0.99 payments didn't actually go through, even though the app said they would, so I was protected from at least losing that money.

author: crasshipster
title: Unrivalled.  Period.  The Best by far!
content:
I just tried 6 OCR apps, including this one and ABBY, and deleted 8.  Kept this one only.  Now I finally have a scanner, not a photocopier.

The OCR is incredible!  What you get is large crystal clear font, legible, text.  Not a mass of tiny text filled with random characters or a fuzzy PDF.  The article I scanned was narrow - lots of hyphens - which confused the other apps completely such that they couldn't make coherent words from hypenated ones, or figure out the hyphens at all.  This app created complete words from hyphenated ones.  No other app results came close to this one - I only had to make one minor correction.  Fast, accurate.  Stellar!

Thank you for an outstanding OCR experience.

author: IPad Ziggy
title: Great scanning app
content:
Great app for scanning documents and photos. One great feature is the auto take and crop. Just aim at your document or photo, follow on screen instructions and it will snap the photo and crop the image for you. 
I have to send copies of receipts to my main office on a daily basis. Use to take them home and fax them. It was a pain. Not to mention sometimes loosing them before sending. Now as soon as I get in my truck I pull out my phone and use this app to scan and send a PDF copy to my office. Also can send as a image file. If I need to add an image or another PDF page I just send the file to PDF Expert. 
Another great feature is text recognition. I haven't used that much. One thing is it has to be printed text. But does a fair job at it.

author: InquiryQueen.co
title: Worth every penny!
content:
This app is great!  I've wanted to go paperless for years and this app is making it possible!

It's very easy to scan and save documents; I can crop documents and even make adjustments to make shadows (usually from crease marks in the paper) disappear completely.  

I can keep scanned documents organized by creating folders and renaming the scanned documents.  I have a folder for receipts, copies of utility statements and bills; I even have temporary folders for content I'm not sure whether I need to keep or not.  

I've even created a "To Do" folder for topics I'd like to research, items I'm thinking of purchasing, and trips I'd like to plan.  I'm no longer carrying around and saving scraps of paper serving as reminders. 

I purchased this app in a productivity bundle and I can't wait to try out the other apps as well.  This was well worth the money I spent!

author: Tick5
title: Still My Favorite
content:
I've been using this for 4-5 years now and it's still my favorite.  Being able to scan and upload pdfs so easily has made it so easy to keep my documents.

Basically if you're interested in making your document library digital, this is for you.  The automatic paper sizing works even better that previous versions and it is very easy to correct in the event it doesn't.  You can do color, greyscale, or black and white and the automatic contrast/brightness is spot on 98% of the time. Changing the document orientation to landscape/portrait is super easy and I use this any time I want PDFs with varying orientation pages, something I can't seem to find how to do with a non Acrobat Pro program/app.

The absolutely only glitch I've seen is that on a rare occasion if a corner of a document is mostly blank the program smudges a different color.

Thanks Scanner Pro!

author: TO BUSY FIR COMPLICATED
title: Near perfect - will meet and exceed expectations
content:
I use scanner Pro on a weekly basis and it accurately captures the image on the first try. 

I would buy again and recommend you do too if you want a phone or tablet scanner that is simple - fast - and works with multiple documents by simply turning the page and letting auto capture do the work!! 

You can scan in black white or color and clarity and quality equals or exceeds what you get from an office scanner. 

You can save your scan into a PDF or JPEG format and quickly name the document and immediately email it or use other ways to distribute it such as Dropbox, Google Drive , iCloud export, Evernote, One Drive. 

I suggest emailing the document immediately for quick reference. 

Cons: 

No search function for a scanned documents after saving. 

You can see all documents scanned easily and search by using the radar feature to see date of scan but searching by name is not available to my knowledge.

author: mayhawjelly
title: Best solution to reducing paper records
content:
I use Scanner Pro on a daily basis to keep records of daily receipts, vendor/product bills, manuals, and any other important papers that I receive. Once I've copied them they go in the trash or shredder. I've been doing this about two years and my paper records have ceased to grow.  Each year I move the scanned records for that year to a file elsewhere to keep the Scanner Pro folder to a manageable size. This method works very well for me--I have immediate access to all my files.
Near the end of the year when the app's folder gets larger and before I've moved the files in the folder elsewhere, it takes a little longer to open. Similarly if I'm scanning in a large document to a vendor file, I have sometimes experienced the app crashing. But these problems are minor. I do recommend when starting a new file for a vendor to save it early on with a proper name--if you do this, then any additional scans to the file will automatically be saved--if the app crashes you won't lose work.

Other than that there are so many bugs. Please fix this issue it makes my life so much harder having to make separate PDFs out of a million individual pages your app didn't separate even though they were scanned in as such. author: Big Eddie Style
title: One of my fave Utility apps
content:
So easy to use! Use it all the time. Got rid of my real world scanner. I save copies of lots of important docs. Its easy to send copies of scans as PDFs via email to yourself and others. I back it up to Evernote bc I've accidentally deleted the app and might have lost all my docs. I recommend it to people all the time!

Downgraded my review to only 4 stars bc it seems kinda buggy lately (2016-11-09). 
It is still a little slow. Seems the more docs you have saved the slower it gets...(update 2017-05-04).

Sending the scans via email hasn't worked so well recently. The emails never arrive. 

So I've been uploading to Google Drive instead. This is an okay work-around. 

Also, it's been crashing occasionally, perhaps because 50 or so scanned documents in it but that doesn't seem like an unreasonable amount. It should be able to handle 1000s of scan IMHO.

7/19/2016 I continue to appreciate what this app does for me. The automatic picture taking is my favorite feature.
1/28/2017 This is still one of my favorite apps. I use it to scan documents when I want them in digital form. I lay the report on the floor with each page up. Then I hold the phone over each page in order. The app focuses, takes the picture, and is ready for the next page. A 10 page report will only take a few seconds.

I will surely enjoy it when everything is updated with the OCR.

author: Mike-mn
title: Problem with file names. Won't work in app "imazing"
content:
DEVELOPER. SEE NOTES AT BOTTOM. 
Update Dec 02 2016
I contacted imazing tech-support and they say Scanner Pro must be doing something wrong with the way files are named. I tend to agree because I can email scans to myself and they work fine but trying to transfer using imazing (formerly disksid) only produces odd named files. 
Changing the naming preferences in the settings doesn't help.

I use this app all the time, several times a day.
Since the last update file names are not correct. Under settings you can select from templates but none are working for me on my iPhone 6 with the latest iOS. I have tried several templates and I have rebooted my phone but the names continue to be 000.jpg 001, 002.....
With each new session the numbers start over so I wind up with duplicate named files and when I try to transfer them my computer won't allow that and makes a mess for knowing what the files are or when they were created.
Tested some things myself and I'm finding that the problem is probably in how the file is named and "imaging" can't figure it out.
Any chance the developer can contact "imazing" and figure out what the problem is?
Everything was fine before updating my phone.

author: machineinthestudio
title: High quality scans & continued commitment to maintenance from the developers
content:
I am using elements of the same review for the PDF Expert app and the Scanner Pro app because together, the two apps make research much easier for students, archivists, researchers, etc. Reviews for each app contain comments for specific features but as a whole, the ability to scan than immediately label, add notes, and organize materials from your phone (and then save to a cloud drive) has made organizing archival research much easier - anyone who has emerged from archives having a hundreds of photos or copied paper documents will appreciate these two apps. The reliability of the app and included features let's me use this for non-research purposes like sending excerpts of books to friends or creating duplicate copies of documents signed in person (leases, etc.). 

As far as scanning apps go, Scanner Pro specifically is the best because of a superior scanning mechanism and various features that result in fairly high quality PDFs even when printed. More often than not (and that's what I have come to expect from apps) Scanner Pro app reliably and accurately detects borders, flattens/smooths any scans of curved pages, and OCR is fairly good in creating searchable PDFs. What makes Scanner Pro superior to other scanning apps, both free and paid, include editing options that improve the quality of any scanned documents: preset page sizes (A4, letter, etc.); adjusting brightness, contrast, page borders. Additionally, the app has many sharing options and reliably maintains access to various cloud storage services. I like the options to create workflows like "Upload all documents to Dropbox folder and then delete," which helps me stay organized. 

One feature that I would like added is the ability to set the page size when editing scanned images. Yes, you can adjust the settings for a default page size - generally, this is fine yet I don't always remember to do this before scanning an odd-sized book, and it seems easy enough to add the option "set all pages to X size" to the editing menu. The GDrive text recognition mechanism never works but this could easily be the fault of GDrive and not Scanner Pro; moreover,- Scanner Pro's native OCR has worked well enough that I don't need or miss the GDrive option. 

Finally a note on the price: the upfront, one-time purchase prices for PDF Expert and Scanner Pro (I think that I purchased these as a bundle) have been justified as I've used both apps enough to offset equivalent scanning and copying costs. What makes PDF Expert and Scanner Pro apps different from similar apps has been reliability functionality in terms of native features as well as app maintenance, something that has really dropped off in the past years for many types of apps, even paid ones and even ones that require a subscription. I highly recommend paying upfront for these apps because you will receive reliable features and regular updates, and hopefully prevents any price hikes with other apps when regular features suddenly become new "premium" features that you have to pay for again. Readdle's continued functionality and commitment to updating these apps means that  they are confident in the products and services that they provide and I am more likely to trust Readdle digital products in the future.

author: Seperry
title: Best Scanner App
content:
I've tried a few scanning apps, and this one is the best. Very intuitive auto cropping with good manual cropping if necessary, nice logical workflow to select file size, color/grey scale/high contrast modes, and seamless automatic upload to my Google Apps account (optionally other cloud services can be used as well). Also, it has a good file management system to mass delete scans that reside on your phone after the cloud upload has been completed. 

I'll admit that when I'm in my office, sometimes I'll reach for my iPhone/Scanner Pro scanning solution before using my desktop scanner!

content: Not only does this app capture printed documents like a champ, it  does a phenomenal job with inked lineart, for comics and what have you. The app has a great autocropping feature which has the camera automatically take the picture without you pressing the shutter - but you can manually tweak the borders if it's not quite the way you want it. I have an actual scanner at home, but in many circumstances the app actually works better! Also - I'm one of those people who never spends a cent on apps if they can help it, but this one is definitely worth the price!

-the automatic borders suggested by the guidelines are too close to the text

Thanks for the great app!!!

title: Hand drawn blueprints to PDF
content:
I've used this in the field when I am hours away from the fab shop on a small job that is not setup with any CAD prints or spool sheets. I'll layout a job and then make an Isometric Pipe Sketch. This is very helpful when I don't have an office trailer. 

You don't have to have the best of lighting to create the PDF. If it's bright enough to not use flash, the image is very high quality. Sometimes better than a scanner at keeping faint lines still visible. 

Being able to sync it with Dropbox is awesome.

title: ‚ÄºÔ∏èMUST READ‚ÄºÔ∏è
content:
I have been dismissing Readdle's "do you want to leave us a review" prompt for nearly 3 years now, so it is only fair I FINALLY give them a moment of my time to throw some Kudo's their way...

The slight learning curve I experienced among some of their Apps might have initially earned them 4 stars, but in all honesty, I can't deny; my iPhone went from favorite gadget to "Productivity POWERHOUSE" once I discovered the scanner App. It was only 20 or 30 minutes later I was "In Love"...

Within an hour, I purchased the premium version of ALL their apps. I am about 3 years in as a user and - even as a stay home Mom, I use one or more of these Apps EVERY day!

I scan receipts, homework, ads, photos - I convert URL links, screen shots and files to PDF, I am INFATUATED with Prizmo too.... You cannot go wrong with Readdle! 

Roll the dice, flip a coin, close your eyes and choose at random. Whichever one you try first, will undoubtedly be the beginning of a beautiful, lifelong friendship! üòâüëç

Since loading all of Readdle's Apps back in 2014, I have only used my computers/laptop a handful of times! As the owner of a $300 Fujitsu "Scansnap" scanner, you would think the two would be incomparable. I no longer use my high end scanner. I even prefer the app for converting my daughter's 100 page workbooks to PDF!! 

I'm not a blogger, not a reviewer, not an affiliate of any kind. But - wholeheartedly; I love their products so much - I would work for Readdle if I could! I love their Apps enough to guarantee you'll love them the same! 

Meg üëçüòâ

author: Extruba
title: Just try it for free! It's real timesaver!
content:
It's so convenient and somewhat empowering to have a scanner in your pocket!

I dropped off a medical document (that already had 2 signatures) for the 3rd and final signature. 
This practice looked a little chaotic - so as the receptionist was taking it - I pulled out my phone and used the Scanner Pro.
Sure enough, they lost it.
I had the document scanned on my phone! 
I sent it to their printer, the 3rd doctor signed it, I scanned it and sent it to the DMV.
 DONE!

Sometimes you just need a copy of something and don't have time for your copy machine or scanner!

This is also great for duplicating pictures without taking frames apart and using slower desktop scanner.

I simply capture receipts, push them to Dropbox, and they are immediately available on my computer for expense submission. Very polished interface. This thing just works. Brilliant the way it deskews an image and removes perspective. it's almost fun to use. Very well thought out.

Update: 4/19/2014 just gets better and better. Save every receipt I get to Dropbox.  My "Go To" app to digitize.

Update 5/12/2015: features just get better and better!!

Update 8/7/2016
Continued greatness. I use this app almost daily to scan and catalog my receipts.

Update 3/25/2017
Probably the most valuable app on my mobile device. THE one app I wouldn't want to do without.

author: Glubstermeister
title: Best Scanner App
content:
Encrypted storage with Touch ID protection. Excellent OCR in various languages. Radar scanner looking for any local images to offer for pfd'ing. 

Preset "workflows" to email or save to specific locations such as DropBox or Google. 

Also lets you "start with camera" which I like - instead of always having to choose between it and photo album. 

It's the best scanner app around and that's coming from a previous GeniusScan user (no OCR and slower to use than this app).

Update: The Auto Picture taking feature with a "flash" is excellent too. Auto crops to page size. So fast. 

Highly recommend above other scanner apps out there.

author: dforvendetta
title: Disappointed
content: I had high hopes for this app, but after only using it a few times I've gotten so frustrated with its lack of usability that I can barely stand to work with it. It never actually scans when I tap the button, it just continues to readjust the blue outline around the page. It only ever manages to finally scan when I'm moving the phone quickly away from (or sometimes towards) the page, which causes blurring. I have to sit in front of a single page for several minutes, moving the phone towards and away from the page over and over again, to get a single scan. Working with this app simply takes too long to make it worth it. It gets two stars for the quality of the few scans that actually do work correctly, but I can't recommend this app at all.

title: It just works!

Retakes, if needed though, are easy as pie and can be done a page at a time, even after the document has been saved. Uploads automatically to your choice of cloud storage, and easily shares via email or text. Can also create PDF's from existing photos in your picture library. author: Star 7147
title: SCANNER PRO ... Most Amazing APP EVER!!!!!!!!!!
content:
THIS APP does it all 

* The design is flawless
* Able to make folders and name them
* Will copy color as well as B/W
* scans are auto or manual
* I PERSONALLY PREFER AUTO (Here's Why)
	1. Senses when document is within range, no balancing the margins like other scan apps.
	2. No need to worry about items along edge of document, you get a clean white straight and balanced result.
	3. Takes a picture (scan) of just the document not item(s) outside that you may see through the camera.
	4. Able to move scans into folder(s) of your choice.
	5. Also able to continuous scan and collect all the pages into one document, and in the sequence they were taken.

The developer of this APP did a top rated superb job!!!

Hello,

It also crops the image automatically & you don't have to push a button to take the shot. It crops & activates by itself, you just line up the document & hold your cell still, it does the rest. You can name your document & as soon as you hit save, it on the way to the clouds, less than 2 seconds  on a single page, I uploaded a PDF 11 page in 3 seconds.
Thank you for reading.

content:
It says in the description that you can edit & sign PDF's. This is a lie. Selecting the option to edit the PDF opens the App Store to a separate app that costs $9.99.

Especially since it allows one to upload everything directly to Dropbox, google drive, etc., which makes is really easy to share or print. 10/10 app, I would have paid much more for it.

author: jlockley
title: document loss/can't find out how to rid photos from camers.  A mess.
content:
New issue: I use this to keep international documents without carrying them. I have just discovered that Scanner Pro imported 1500 photos from my collection, making it impossible to separate out the documents. I cannot find any way to get rid of them on the support site,,just how to import them. I am seeking a new scanner. 
I have been using this as a travel scanner. I scanned a series of documents related to a bank account which are missing from the library. My guess is that I thought I had saved them and had not. A delete button can be found now and then, but it does not function well, so deleting documents no longer needed is either difficult or impossible.   The quality of many documents is poor. You cannot scan with a light on in a room, as shadows are extreme. Finding borders is cumbersome. Despite a successful and fast wi-fi systsem in this location the scanner seems unable to connect. Scanner Pro has left me up a creek with no paddle in a very time sensitive and high value transaction. It does back up to dropbox.

OCR is )like everything else OCR that's not $$$$$) based on open source stuff that isn't 100% reliable, but still does an impressive job.
